text: Euphyllia baliensis, commonly known as bubble coral, is a species of large- polyped stony coral belonging to the family Euphylliidae. ==Description== It is best distinguished from other members of the genus Euphyllia by its "comparatively very small corallites (averaging 3 mm diameter) and much shorter, thinner, lightly calcified branches." ==Distribution & habitat== It can be found at depths of 27 to 37 meters off the central eastern coast of Bali, Indonesia. The species has not been reported from any other locality. == References == Category:Animals described in 2012
title: Euphyllia baliensis
